intro: Roupala inaequalis, commonly known as the unequal roupala, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its evergreen nature and distinctive foliage. The plant produces small, clustered inflorescences that bear white or pale pink flowers, which are typically visited by various pollinators. Its leaves are usually leathery and have a rough texture, contributing to its adaptability in shaded environments. Roupala inaequalis is often found in humid, forested areas where it thrives in partial to full shade.
